revised_title: High-Affinity Binding of Moult-Inhibiting Hormone and Crustacean Hyperglycaemic Hormone to Y-Organ Receptors in Shore Crabs
tldr: The study investigates the high-affinity binding of moult-inhibiting hormone (MIH) and crustacean hyperglycaemic hormone (CHH) to membrane-bound receptors on the Y-organ of the shore crab Carcinus maenas. The findings suggest a complex, multihormonal control of moulting in crustaceans, with both hormones showing specific binding to Y-organ receptors. This research strengthens the role of these hormones in moult control and their physiological significance.
